unnormalised: **Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches in India**
normalised: Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches in India

unnormalised: Recent weeks have witnessed a flurry of activity in the Indian automotive sector, with manufacturers unveiling new models catering to diverse consumer needs. Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute reports a 15% increase in vehicle launches compared to last year.
normalised: Recent weeks have witnessed a flurry of activity in the Indian automotive sector, with manufacturers unveiling new models catering to diverse consumer needs. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute reports a fifteen percent increase in vehicle launches compared to last year.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki, a household name, launched its highly anticipated compact SUV, the 'Breeza Lite', priced attractively around Rs. 7.5 Lakhs. This launch aims to capture the entry-level SUV market segment, particularly popular in Tier-2 cities.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki, a household name, launched its highly anticipated compact S U V, the 'Breeza Lite', priced attractively around rupee seven point five lakhs. This launch aims to capture the entry-level S U V market segment, particularly popular in Tier two cities.

unnormalised: Tata Motors, riding high on its electric vehicle success, unveiled the 'Nexon EV Max', boasting an extended range of 450 km on a single charge. The Nexon EV Max is manufactured at their Pune plant, which recently expanded by 20,000 sq ft.
normalised: Tata Motors, riding high on its electric vehicle success, unveiled the 'Nexon E V Max', boasting an extended range of four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge. The Nexon E V Max is manufactured at their Pune plant, which recently expanded by twenty thousand square feet.

unnormalised: Mahindra & Mahindra showcased the Bolero Neo+, a rugged off-roader inspired by its legacy Bolero, targeted towards rural markets and adventure enthusiasts. Industry experts believe these launches signal a positive outlook for the Indian automotive industry, driven by increasing disposable incomes and improved infrastructure. These new vehicles promise advanced features and improved fuel efficiency in response to consumer demands.
